channel.title: Comments on: Mirroring SQL Server 2005 to SQL Server 2008 (Part 1)
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Curtis
item.dc:creator: Curtis
item.description: You mentioned that "Once you initiate your failover, you can back the SQL Server 2008 database up while still in 90 compatibility and restore back to SQL Server 2005." How do you do that? I have tried exactly that though Mangement Studio and been unsuccessful.
item.content:encoded: You mentioned that “Once you initiate your failover, you can back the SQL Server 2008 database up while still in 90 compatibility and restore back to SQL Server 2005.” How do you do that? I have tried exactly that though Mangement Studio and been unsuccessful.

item.title: By: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.dc:creator: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.description: Thanks David. Let me know how it goes and if you have any questions behind this post
item.content:encoded: Thanks David. Let me know how it goes and if you have any questions behind this post

item.title: By: David
item.dc:creator: David
item.description: Thank you for this article. I am in the process of planning a migration of 2005 to 2008 R2, while also upgrading the application that has been built on top of it. Like your company, mine is also very sensitive to downtime. We have hundreds of gigs worth of database files to move, and we are looking to a mirroring strategy to minimize downtime.
item.content:encoded: Thank you for this article. I am in the process of planning a migration of 2005 to 2008 R2, while also upgrading the application that has been built on top of it. Like your company, mine is also very sensitive to downtime. We have hundreds of gigs worth of database files to move, and we are looking to a mirroring strategy to minimize downtime.

item.title: By: Storagecraft
item.dc:creator: Storagecraft
item.description: You are absolutely right. There are many benefits in upgrading SQL Server and also having many ways in planning and executing the process. The diagram showed is very perfect.
item.content:encoded: You are absolutely right. There are many benefits in upgrading SQL Server and also having many ways in planning and executing the process. The diagram showed is very perfect.
